name: A Universe Made of Strings
description:
In Each Hand A Cutlass' debut album, released on 24 June 2011. The packaging is gorgeous - a digipack that unfolds to reveal a pop-up pirate ship, with a slide-out cardboard tray that houses the CD. Embossed letterings adorn the cover and tray. Produced by Roland Lim and mixed and mastered by Jens Bogren (Opeth / Soilwork / James LaBrie), the album sounds as stunning as it looks.

"Songs dip and rise, creep and flip, much like an imaginary soundtrack to a mind-twisting film." - Straits Times' Life!

“…wonderful debut album…a dynamic array of sounds and styles that demand repeating listens to divine its multitude of pleasures!” - PowerOfPop.com

"Strong hooks, syncopated beats and deft pacing help to maintain interest in the absence of lyrics." - Business Times

"...an explosive debut...a purely instrumental, mystical ride that plays out like a soundtrack to a sci-fi film." - MyPaper

"...a sure-footed, impressive debut..." - TimeOut Singapore

"...the band's deserved of a show to write music for." - Juice Singapore

Streaming tracks (including the album sampler) can be heard at:

http://listn.to/InEachHandACutlass

http://www.ineachhandacutlass.com/av-room

---
Track Listing:

1. The Escape (1.12)
2. Inspector Cutlass (4.49)
3. Glaciers (8.28)
4. The March (1.21)
5. Helmets And Fiery Endings (5.56)
6. Chocolate And The Lovelorn Girl (5.20)
7. Marauder (6.11)
8. White Boxes (6.15)
9. End Of The Line (0.51)
10. Hammering The Bones (4.41)
11. A Universe Made Of Strings (6.19)
